member.name: T:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue
member.summary: Used for creating and referencing uScript data types in a VM-compatible format. All values in uScript are ExpressionValues.

member.name: F:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.Undefined
member.summary: An ExpressionNode with an undefined state.

member.name: F:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.Null
member.summary: An ExpressionNode with a null state.

member.name: F:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.True
member.summary: An ExpressionNode with a true state (boolean).

member.name: F:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.False
member.summary: An ExpressionNode with a false state (boolean).

member.name: M:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.Array(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{uScript.Core.ExpressionValue})
member.summary: Used to format an IEnumerable of ExpressionValues into an Array ExpressionValue.

member.name: M:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.CreateObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Used to create an instance of a ScriptClass. Note: Used frequently in ScriptEvents.

member.name: M:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.Object(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{uScript.Core.ExpressionValue,uScript.Core.ExpressionValue}})
member.summary: Used to format an IEnumerable of KeyValuePairs into an Object ExpressionValue.

member.name: P:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.AsDictionary
member.summary: Returns a dictionary instance of the object's values.

member.name: P:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.AsList
member.summary: Returns a list instance of the array's values.

member.name: P:uScript.Core.ExpressionValue.Data
member.summary: Returns the object contained by the ExpressionValue. Anything that isn't one of the base data types is considered an object.
